resources.string: This is a game for two players. One of the two players must be the host, and the other must then connect to the hosting player before the game session can start. \n\n1.) First, one of the two players must initiate a game by pressing the button named "Host Game" in the Main Menu. The player will then be prompted with a screen seen as the one seen below. The player has now hosted a game with a given IP-address and is waiting for an opponent.

2.) When the first player has initiated a game and is currently waiting for an opponent, the other player must press the button name "Join Game" in the Main Menu. The player will then be prompted with a screen seen as the one seen below.

3.) In the bottom part of the screen, the player can pick colors(default is blue). There are four slots for guessing the color of each slot in the solution. The player must choose between six different colors for each of the four slots. When the player has decided that the guess is complete and ready to be sent, the button "OK" must be press to enter the guess.

4.) Below is an example of the game screen after the first entry of a player's guess has be entered. The last guess will be displayed at the top of the list as a row including the colors of the player's previous guess, and the pegs(Pegs, black and white, are explained in detail in the paragraph below) at the end of the row displaying the correctness of the colors in the guess. 

As seen in the screen example below, there is a text in top left corner of the screen that informs the player of who's turn it is. It states: "It is your turn" if it is the current player's turn, else it states: "It is not your turn" if it is the opponent's turn. When it is not your turn, you can still submit guesses, but the list of the opponents keyPegs will not be updated until, he or she has submitted their next guess. 

The guesses will be ordered in a list, making it possible to scroll in the history of guesses and using this history to make conclusions about the solution.

5.) KeyPeg Description: 

We have to types of keyPegs: 

BLACK: A peg with the color black indicates that one of the four guesses(color) is the correct color AND at the correct slot. But it does not indicate which one of there is correctly placed. 
\and 

WHITE: A peg with the color white indicates that one of the four guesses(color) is the color, but not placed in the correct slot. Meaning, that if you replace a color to the correct slot, the peg will turn from black to white. 

When one of the two players has submitted a guess identical to the solution, the guess in the list will have four black pegs associated to it, and both players will be informed of result of the game(win or loss). 

Graphical view of pegs: 
For each guess a player can view in the list how many correctly guessed slots(BLACK) and correctly guessed color(WHITE) to rightmost end of the row. A player should use the information given about white and black pegs from all the guesses, to make further guesses that approaches the solution. 
In the top right corner of the game screen the player can view the result of the opponents latest guess, in the form of black and white. In other words, a player can not use the opposing player's guess to enhance the performance, but only view his/hers progress. 

You are now now ready to begin playing MindMaster, good luck!
